dish_description: The dish is a classic American mac and cheese, which involves cooking pasta and mixing it with a homemade cheese sauce. The dish is then topped with a browned panko crust for added texture and flavor.

cooking_steps.description: Start by making a white sauce (roux) by melting a tablespoon and a half of butter and then adding a tablespoon and a half of flour to it, stirring until well mixed.
Gradually add a cup and a half of milk to the roux, stirring continuously, and bring the mixture to a boil to thicken the sauce.
Season the white sauce with salt, pepper, and about a teaspoon of paprika.

Prepare the panko crust by mixing three-quarters of a cup of panko with a tablespoon of olive oil to prevent it from burning. Bake in the oven at 350 degrees Fahrenheit for about 5 to 8 minutes until browned.
Cook 1 and a half cups of dry macaroni according to the package instructions until al dente, which will yield about 3 cups of cooked pasta.
Once the white sauce is ready, add cheese to it and stir until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth. Turn off the heat or keep it very low during this process.
Combine the cooked macaroni with the cheese sauce, bring to a boil, and cook together for a couple of minutes. Season to taste.

Finish the dish by topping the mac and cheese with the browned panko mixture, a good tablespoon of Parmesan cheese, and a couple of tablespoons of chives. Serve immediately with the option to add more pepper on top.
